availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas D. Carr (Lexington, Kentucky, deputy sheriff)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Carr and Nancy Dudley Carr. Married to Sallie E. Carr. Father of John Carr and Lulie Carr. Trader in Fayette County in 1850. Resided in a household with sixteen enslaved persons in 1850. Deputy sheriff of Fayette County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 244. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District No. 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 111. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 60. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 29. Find A Grave, "Thomas Dudley Carr (1827-1911)," Memorial #79163821, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=79163821 (accessed April 27, 2017).
